result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy A. Robinson

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: $100.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.

11:15 a.m.  Defendant in custody.  Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for 5/13/22, 8:30 a.m.
Minutes
Further proceedings scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:49 AM Defendant Jeremy A. Robinson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Dominique McQueen appeared by video for Jeremy A. Robinson. 
Defense has received a copy of the Criminal Complaint, waives formal reading, and demands a preliminary hearing.
Defense counsel is willing to waive time limits. Defendant objects and they are placed in a break out room. 

Recalled at 10:58 AM same appearances
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing. There has been no inducement. 
Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.
Arraignment scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.

recording transfer to DAR at later date due to technical issue. Time reflects another matter due to breakout
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of obstruct officer.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 03-31-22 at 10:30 a.m.  Bail is set at $100.00 cash bond with the conditions that defendant must provide an address to the Clerk of Court Office, in writing, within 24 hours of release.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.
Minutes.
